availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. A. Turner, Jr. (Owingsville, Kentucky, circuit clerk)

body.p: Owingsville, Kentucky, circuit clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Juliet Turner. Father of Robert Turner, Lydia H. Turner, Joshua E. Turner, Nannie Turner, and Juliet Turner. Clerk of the Bath Circuit Court from 1850 to 1862. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Owingsville in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 6. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 6-7. KYR-0001-020-1438. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 303-308.
